If you have projects nested in other projects in your workspace, the option exists for right-clicking a plugin.xml file and doing PDE Tools > Create And Build File. 

However, this option throws a NPE (and has for probably a year, but stupidly, I've never reported it, just cursed and worked around it).

I would suggest either trapping this exception and telling the user "Project must be at the root of your workspace. Use Import > General > Existing Projects into Workspace, then try again" or if time permits this late in the dev cycle, allowing nested projects to create build.xml files. Why do the projects have to be top-level anyway? What's wrong with having nested projects?
